title: IBM Cloud® Databases for etcd docs
introduction: etcd is a distributed, reliable key-value store for the most critical data of a distributed system.

section_recommended.title: Getting Started
section_recommended.description: A brief tutorial to introduce using an IBM Cloud® Databases for etcd deployment.

section_recommended.title: Setting the Admin Password
section_recommended.description: The Databases for etcd service is provisioned with an admin user. You must set the password before you use it to connect.

section_recommended.title: Creating Users and Getting Connection Strings
section_recommended.description: To connect to IBM Cloud® Databases for etcd, you need some users and connection strings. Connection Strings for your deployment are displayed on the Dashboard Overview, in the Endpoints panel. These strings can be used with any set of credentials that you generate.

tiles.title: New hosting models
tiles.description: You can choose between two hosting models: Isolated Compute and Shared Compute. Isolated Compute is a secure single-tenant offering for complex, highly performant enterprise workloads. Shared Compute is a flexible multi-tenant offering for dynamic, fine-tuned, and decoupled capacity selections.

tiles.title: Monitoring Integreation documentation updated
tiles.description: Monitoring Integration documentation now lists metrics for all Cloud Databases services.

tiles.title: Upgrading to a new Major Version
tiles.description: Documentation on Upgrading to a new Major Version published.
